discussion.content:
Regulatory records is the most restrictive record and then comes "record".

User1 wont be able to delete File2 since its marked as regulatory record
User2 can rename File1 since its allowed if its marked as a record
User1 will be able to add retention 2 to File1 since File1 is only marked as a record
was on Exam August 9, 2023

Answers are correct and can be verified in the Action table at the following link:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/records-management?view=o365-worldwide#compare-restrictions-for-what-actions-are-allowed-or-blocked
Correct.
So agreed with answer 'E' .... Global administrator does not have recordsmanagement permissions by default.

comments.content: Yes, by default, the Compliance Administrator and Compliance Data Administrator role groups have the Disposition Management role assigned,

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The only user with the required Records Management role is Admin3. Being listed as a reviewer does not grant the necessary permissions to Admin1 and Admin2.
on exam thu nov 9
The stage one reviewer section lists: admin1, admin2, and admin3. I'm going with 'F'

Disposition review can only performed members of Disposition Management Role, by default both Compliance Administrator och Compliance Data Administrator have access to this but NOT GA.
Record management can also perform these reviews.

Agreed. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/disposition?view=o365-worldwide
To successfully access the Disposition tab in the Microsoft Purview compliance portal, users must have the Disposition Management role. From December 2020, this role is now included in the Records Management default role group.

Records management is part of the compliance administrator roles

Should be 'B'…2 policies. 1 for Exchange mail, Sharepoint Sites and Microsoft 365 Groups. And 1 for teams chats and teams channel messages.

Selected Answer: B
Note:
When you use adaptive policies instead of static policies, you can configure a single retention policy to include both Teams and Viva Engage locations. 
This isn't the case for static policies where Teams and Viva Engage locations require their own retention policy.

With love~

Selected Answer: B
is B you need minimum 2

We need 2 policies since we are going to retain data in Teams and more location, Teams cant be configured in a policy together with other locations choosed.
Try this out!

This link:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/create-retention-policies?view=o365-worldwide&tabs=teams-retention#create-and-configure-a-retention-policy

has the following statement:

If you select the Teams or Yammer locations when you create a retention policy, the other locations are automatically excluded. This means that the instructions to follow depend on whether you need to include the Teams or Yammer locations.

So based on that, you would need 2 at minimum.

Selected Answer: B
Agreed, Teams policies deselect when you select the others.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You need to create static retention policies for the following locations:

• Teams chats
• Exchange email
• SharePoint sites
• Microsoft 365 Groups
• Teams channel messages

What is the minimum number of retention policies required?

You have a Microsoft 365 tenant that uses records management.

You use a retention label to mark legal files stored in a Microsoft SharePoint Online document library as regulatory records.

What can you do to the legal files?

choices.D: Change the retention label of the files.
choices.A: Remove the retention label of the files.
choices.B: Edit the content of the files.
choices.C: Move the files to a different folder within the document library.

discussion.content:
same with q23 topic 3
When content is declared a regulatory record, restrictions are placed on the items in terms of what actions are allowed or blocked. Most actions are blocked except:
✑ Copy
✑ Open/Read
✑ Move within container
Note: Containers include SharePoint document libraries, OneDrive accounts, and Exchange mailboxes.
Note:
There are several versions of this question in the exam. The question has two possible correct answers:
1. Move the files to a different folder within the document library.
2. Copy the content of the files.
was on Exam August 9, 2023
Move the files to a different folder with in the container is one of the few things you can do to documents marked as regulatory records

Chart summarizing options is available here:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/records-management?view=o365-worldwide#compare-restrictions-for-what-actions-are-allowed-or-blocked

Selected Answer: C
Correct.

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a Microsoft SharePoint Online site named Site1 and the users shown in the following table.

//IMG//


Site1 includes a file named File1.docx.

You create two retention labels named Retention1 and Retention2.

You publish Retention1 to the following locations:

• Exchange email
• Included: User1
• Microsoft 365 Groups
• Included: Group2

You publish Retention2 to the following locations:

• Exchange email
• Included: All recipients
• SharePoint sites
• Included: Site1

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: User2 is part of Group2 which applies to Retention1. How is this not Yet?

comments.content:
That answer No for second question is correct. The way the retention scenario is bunched up confused me. Look at it this way.

You publish Retention1 to the following locations:

Exchange email
-Included: User1

Microsoft 365 Groups
-Included: Group2

You publish Retention2 to the following locations:

Exchange email
-Included: All recipients

SharePoint sites
-Included: Site1

discussion.content:
Yes, since User1 is a included in both Retention1 and Retention2
No, User2 is not included in Retention1
Yes, since the user is included in Retention2
Why is second one no?

comments.content: Retention1 does not apply to Exchange email for User2 (only for User1)
The Retention1 label locations only allow user 1 to see the label in his his mailbox, while group 2 can only see it as part of an M365 group.
Retention1 will only be available in the Microsoft 365 Group mailbox associated with Group2, not User2’s personal mailbox.
sorry can you better explain why user 2 that is member of the group 2 can not apply the label?

discussion.content: I agree with the given answer.
